audience: High school students preparing for the SAT (Reading & Writing)

teacher_notes.pacing: 45 minutes; pacing benchmarks with short drill.
teacher_notes.materials: Timer, pacing chart, two sample questions.
teacher_notes.assessment: 4-item unit check and a one-sentence pacing rule exit ticket.

structure.title: Scoring & Timing
objectives: Allocate time per question using benchmarks.

lecture_script.script: Your R&W score ranges 200–800. Maintain pace: decide in 20–30 seconds, choose best option, flag if needed, and move on.
Stuck after 25 seconds, I pick my best elimination choice, flag it, and proceed to protect later points.
Two timed items: make a choice within the window, then reflect on whether flagging was needed.
Write your personal pacing rule in one sentence.

worked_example.passage: Because the conference schedule was dense, Jordan reviewed abstracts the night before to decide which talks to attend first.
worked_example.question: What strategy does Jordan use to manage limited time?
worked_example.explanation: Previewing abstracts to prioritize mirrors time-management and pacing.
